comment._content:

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Another to add to the 'coincidences' gallery. Lionel Lindsay - "Balcony, Ferry Lane, The Rocks" 1925 (NLA)

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Whoops, thanks - nearly forgot in all my excitement!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Wow..the art work is identical to the photograph (except for the people). We have officially changed the title to Ferry Lane

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: We wanted to say thank you to pellethepoet who has taken us on a wonderful stroll down Ferry Lane www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/4330217516/

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] The stroll isn't over yet! :) ... Ferry Lane (c.1902) by Sydney Long

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Just for interest, there's a pic of Ferry Lane in this fascinating 1901 Sydney Mail article on the Rocks resumptions - news.google.com/newspapers?id=twFQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=-5QDA...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks so much for that!!! It's the same photo that appeared in ‘The City of Sydney: the Story of its Growth From its Foundation to the Present Day’ by John Arthur Barry (NSW Bookstall Company, 1902), page 76, a copy of which is in the collection of the Macleay Museum, University of Sydney. They let me share it here - 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/5036046594/]

I'll pass on the info to them, as their date for this photo is c.1902 (from the date the booklet was published). Your article shows it dates from the previous year.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] The early Sydney "expert" Dr. Houison mentioned in the article is Dr. Andrew Houison (1850-1912) - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Houison . His papers, and I imagine his photo collection mentioned in the article, are held by the State Library of NSW - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=949776

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet]  This is interesting! Just looking at these fantastic images of Ferry Lane, I can appreciate why it held such an attraction for artists and photographers. Next time I'm in Sydney I'll have to spend a bit of time wandering around the Rocks. Haven't spent more than 10 minutes there in yonks alas. John Arthur Barry appears to have written quite a few feature articles for the Sydney Mail at the turn of the 20th century. Some articles appear under the initials J.A.B. I'd say it's reasonable to assume these are his.
